channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA

item.title: Report E-2024010480
item.description:
Report E-2024010480

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 23, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon drum of paint was damaged due to a faulty pallet and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior, dock floor, and pavement of the terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released product inside of the trailer and to the pavement underneath, and they swept them up with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads and cleaners to wipe down the impacted trailer floor and underside of the trailer. One (1) 55-gallon drum containing the impacted drum of product and one (1) 55-gallon drum of spent absorbents and any cleanup debris were both labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.
